title: Strong positional game
summary: A strong positional game (also called Maker-Maker game) is a kind of positional game.[1]: 9–12  Like most positional games, it is described by its set of positions ( X {\displaystyle X} ) and its family of winning-sets ( F {\displaystyle {\mathcal {F}}} - a  family of subsets of X {\displaystyle X} ). It is played by two players, called First and Second, who alternately take previously-untaken positions.
